lanapatelxoxo: My maternal grandmother needs a new kidney and is on Dialysis and I found out my grandfather had stage four cancer two days after my birthday ( my birthday was on Diwali last year and I happened to be celebrating Diwali at my Mandir the day I found out). I cried so hard because my maternal grandparents raised me do my grandfather is like my father and I didn't see it coming. I felt so guilty for moving to LA and leaving them behind but I also knew that I needed to make it out here so I could take care of them like they took care of me. I went back home for Thanksgiving and was so scared if that would be the last time I would see him. He was my strength and such an incredible representation of what an Indian man looks like but this incredibly strong man looked so weak in that hospital bed, he lost over 35 pounds and was so helpless. Well he was able to have surgery and come home for Thanksgiving. I pray for him everyday and I'm so glad he's back with my grandmother and he's able to walk around. They fuel my desire to become my own success story just like you, you're story and determination inspire me more than you'll ever know. I can't wait to see what the future holds for you. Thank you so much for reading this Deepica! 😍 🙏🏽❤️

preethaali: Started following you during your Birchbox days and the videos you would make!
